name: Iris Hub
description: Iris Hub provides an API to allow vendor to vendor communication and purchasing. One way to think about the hub is a modern EDI - very simple REST interface to enable purchasing and fulfillment between two vendors.

purchase_confirmation_status.description: Used to indicate the status of a purchase when the vendor confirms it has been processed.

values.name: shipped
values.description: Indicates that a purchase was successfully shipped.

values.name: cannot_fulfill
values.description: Indicates that a purchase could not be fulfilled - e.g the customer order was short-shipped.

values.name: purchase_created
values.description: Event data is of type purchase.

values.name: purchase_assigned
values.description: Event data is of type purchase_assignment.

values.name: purchase_order_opened
values.description: Event data is of type purchase_order.

values.name: purchase_order_closed
values.description: Event data contains the guid of a closed purchase order.

values.name: purchase_order_authorized
values.description: Event data is of type purchase_order_authorization.

purchase_cancellation_status.description: Indicates the current status of the cancellation.

values.name: in_processing
values.description: Indicates the request has been submitted and no action has been taken.

values.name: cancelled
values.description: Indicates that a purchase has been cancelled. Not necessarily the one requested to be cancelled.

values.name: cannot_cancel
values.description: Indicates that a purchase will not be cancelled.

user.description: A user is a top level person interacting with Iris Hub.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this user.

contact.description: A contact represents contact information for a person.

fields.name: role
fields.description: An optional specific role for this contact

vendor.description: A vendor is one of the main concepts in IRIS HUB. All activity is tied to a vendor.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this vendor

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this vendor - just used as a label for people to read.

fields.name: key
fields.description: A unique, url friendly key for this vendor. keys are always stored in lower case.

vendor_form.description: The data required to create a vendor.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this vendor - just used as a label for people to read.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Tags to be attached to this vendor.

vendor_tag.description: A user can apply one or more tags to a vendor. Tags are private to the user. When creating a vendor, you can also specify a tag to create a vendor tag transactionally which is a useful tool for attaching your own identifier to all vendors.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this vendor tag.

fields.name: tag
fields.description: The actual tag you have applied to this vendor

item.description: An item represents a physical or virtual thing that can be purchased.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: number
fields.description: This is the vendor's unique identifier for this item. The item number is case sensitive.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The number of units that this vendor currently has available for sale.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: Attributes are part of the unique item composition. In they physical world, attributes would be sku-defining properties like color or size.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata are additional properties of an item that are useful generally (like a product category) in describing the item.

fields.name: identifiers
fields.description: Unique identifiers for this item

prices.description: Pricing is structured in the sense of specific types of pricing that can be provided - retail price, sale price, and cost (e.g. wholesale price)

fields.name: retail
fields.description: The retail price for this item

fields.name: sale
fields.description: The recommended sale price for this item if different from retail. This is the price that should be offered to customers when purchasing this item. If not specified, the channel provider can determine the appropriate price.

fields.name: cost
fields.description: The actual cost of this item. If a Vendor A purchases this item from Vendor B, this would be the price of that purchase.

money.description: Money is used to describe a value with currency.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The amount of the money

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The ISO 4217 currency code

attribute.description: An attribute is a critical property of the item - i.e. it identifies an intrinsic property that would be used, for example, in determining a stock keeping unit. Common examples of attributes include size (e.g. a small is a physically different item from a large), color, fabric, etc.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this attribute

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of this attribute for this item

fields.name: locale
fields.description: The locale in which the value is encoded.

metadata.description: Metadata are name/value pairs further describing an item.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this metadata

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of this metadata for this item

fields.name: locale
fields.description: The locale in which the value is encoded.

tag.description: A tag is a name/value pair, representing a user supplied attribute on an entity.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this tag

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of this tag

fields.name: locale
fields.description: The locale in which the value is encoded.

return_policy.description: A return policy defines whether or not an item is returnable and for how long

fields.name: number_days
fields.description: The number of days from purchase that this item can be returned. Specifying a value of 0 means the item is not returnable. A value of 10, for example, means the item is returnable for 10 days from time of purchase.

identifier.description: An identifier is a unique identifier for this item. Common use cases will include providing your own bar code - e.g. a UPC-A or EAN-13 for each of your items

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this identifier

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of this identifier

dimension.description: A physical dimension of an item - e.g. weight, width, height, etc. Each dimension contains a name, a value, and the units in which the measurement was made.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this dimension

fields.name: value
fields.description: The actual value for this dimension

fields.name: units
fields.description: The units for this dimension

content.description: Content refers to a piece of text about this item. Each piece of content can be identified by its name and must specify the locale in which that content is stored.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this content item

fields.name: value
fields.description: The actual textual contents.

fields.name: locale
fields.description: The locale for this value text.

media.description: Media refers to an image or video available via URL.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The full URL where this media is located.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Arbitrary tags associated with this media item.

term.description: Represents the terms by which two vendors are transacting. Primary purpose is to capture things like 'NET30' so that both parties can correctly invoice and pay.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: code
fields.description: An identifier that people at both vendors understand (e.g. NET30).

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description to help people understand the intent of the terms (e.g. Payment is due 30 days after receipt of invoice)

term_form.description: The data needed to create a term.

fields.name: code
fields.description: An identifier that people at both vendors understand (e.g. NET30).

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description to help people understand the intent of the terms (e.g. Payment is due 30 days after receipt of invoice)

payment_terms.description: A description of how payments for services rendered under an agreement are to be made.

fields.name: code
fields.description: An identifier that people at both vendors understand (e.g. NET30).

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description to help people understand the intent of the terms (e.g. Payment is due 30 days after receipt of invoice)

agreement.description: An agreement outlines the terms by which two vendors work together.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this agreement

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: A human readable unique identifier for this agreement. Format will be something like IA2014-123456 - IA: Iris Agreement followed by the year followed by a number.

fields.name: purchasing_vendor_guid
fields.description: The vendor that will be purchasing items - i.e. the vendor that will be responsible for creating the Purchases in Iris Hub

fields.name: fulfilling_vendor_guid
fields.description: The vendor that will be fulfilling items - i.e. the vendor that will be responsible for receiving a shipment request and actually shipping the goods.

fields.name: fulfillment_type
fields.description: Can be set to either 'direct_to_customer' or 'direct_to_purchasing_vendor'. Determines if the fulfilling vendor is going to ship directly to the customer (e.g. drop ship) or ship in bulk to the purchasing vendor who will then cross-dock and ship to customer.

fields.name: term_guid
fields.description: The specific payment terms in place for this agreement

fields.name: begin_datetime
fields.description: The date on which this agreement goes into effect.

fields.name: end_datetime
fields.description: The date on which this agreement ends. If not specified, this agreement is considered perpetual and it never ends.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Determines the currency in which transactions pertaining to this agreement are made. The value is the 3-character upper case iso4217 code for this currency

fields.name: purchasing_vendor_contacts
fields.description: (DETAIL)Contact information for the purchasing vendor.

fields.name: fulfilling_vendor_contacts
fields.description: (DETAIL)Contact information for the fulfilling vendor.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: (DETAIL)Attributes to further define the agreement.

agreement_attributes.description: Attributes to further describe an agreement specifically durations that are a part of the agreement.  You should not re-use the same name as it will override the value.

fields.name: fulfilling_vendor_lead_time
fields.description: The duration of time it takes for a fulfilling vendor to prepare a package for shipment.(ISO 8601 Duration: Example 'P0400-10-20T05:20:10.100')

fields.name: transit_time
fields.description: The duration of time it takes for a package to be sent from a fulfilling vendor and arrive at the purchasing vendor.(ISO 8601 Duration: Example 'P0400-10-20T05:20:10.100')

fields.name: purchasing_vendor_on_dock_processing_time
fields.description: The duration of time it takes for a purchasing vendor to process a package at the dock.(ISO 8601 Duration: Example 'P0400-10-20T05:20:10.100')

fields.name: purchasing_vendor_receiving_time
fields.description: The period of time it takes for a purchasing vendor to receive a package in to inventory.(ISO 8601 Duration: Example 'P0400-10-20T05:20:10.100')

agreement_form.description: The data required to create an agreement.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: 3-character upper case iso4217 code for this currency

agreement_patch.description: Model for an update operation on an agreement.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: 3-character upper case iso4217 code for this currency
If true, make the agreement perpetual. This is a workaround, for the fact that we cannot express this by omitting the end_datetime, which is optional
fields.name: perpetual

shipment_schedule.description: A shipment schedule defines how frequently a fulfilling vendor would like to ship for a particular agreement. A common use case is to ship every week on monday. IRIS will then aggregate pending purchases into a single purchase order on Mondays for the vendor to ship in bulk.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: frequency
fields.description: supported values: immediate (e.g. for drop ship orders create shipment requests immediately following purchase), daily (create one shipment request / day), weekly (create one shipment request / week).

fields.name: begin_datetime
fields.description: Date on which to start schedule. For daily/weekly schedules, determines the day of the week on which to generate a shipment request

planned_shipment.description: A date of the next planned shipment (tied to the closure of the shipment request). It's based on the shipment schedule frequency and begin_datetime

fields.name: datetime
fields.description: The date and time of an upcoming shipment.

address.description: Represents a physical address - e.g. an address to where to ship goods

purchase.description: A purchase represents one vendor purchasing one unit of an item from another vendor. In many ERP systems, the purchase will map to the concept of an order item - e.g. one item on an order. IRIS operates solely on the level of line items to provide a simple interface that gracefully handles many of the operational differences that occur in real life including short shipments, split shipments, etc. Each purchase a destination address which represents the recipient of the purchase - i.e. where the item should be delivered.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: vendor_purchase_number
fields.description: Unique identifier in vendor's system for this purchase. This token is used to ensure that a purchase is not duplicated in IRIS

fields.name: price
fields.description: Price of the item being purchased. Currency is that of the agreement.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Optional metadata associated with this purchase (e.g. a customer order number)

tracking_information.description: Capture tracking information (e.g. UPS tracking number) for purchases that have been shipped.

fields.name: carrier
fields.description: The shipping carrier - e.g. UPS

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: The actual tracking number or identifier

purchase_confirmation.description: For vendors that are shipping direct to customer, the purchase confirmation represents the action that the fulfilling vendor took on behalf of a purchase. Purchases are either 'shipped' or 'cannot_fulfill', and for shipped confirmations, optional tracking information can be provided for the recipient.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this purchase confirmation

fields.name: purchase_guid
fields.description: The purchase that we are confirming. Unique.

fields.name: tracking
fields.description: Optional tracking information for shipped purchases

receipt.description: A receipt represents a single unit of merchandise that was received.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: vendor_receipt_number
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this receipt in the vendor system. Main purpose is to guarantee idempotence

fields.name: code
fields.description: Machine readable code for this specific error message

fields.name: message
fields.description: Description of the error

purchase_order.description: A purchase order refers to a collection of items that the fulfilling vendor should now ship to a single location, subject to the terms of a single agreement. Conceptually - a purchase order relates to one order that the vendor must now ship - containing at least 1 item in it.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: aggregation
fields.description: Describes the aggregation data of the purchases on this purchase order.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Zero or more user supplied tags.

purchase_order_item.description: Represents the quantity of purchases that have been put onto a particular PO for a particular item.

fields.name: item_number
fields.description: The fulfilling vendor's number

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity requested for this item

purchase_order_authorization.description: Before a purchase order is sent to the fulfilling vendor, the purchasing vendor must provide an authorization number (e.g. an internal purchase order number).

purchase_assignment.description: Represents an assignment of a purchase to a purchase order.

event.description: Event envelope. Data object depends on event type.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: URI to which events are sent to using HTTP POST.

fields.name: content_type
fields.description: Format of notifications. Currently: only 'json' is supported.

fields.name: verify_ssl_cert
fields.description: Reject self-signed or expired certificates.

webhook_auth.description: Authorization-related configuration of event webhook. Encrypted in storage.

fields.name: secret
fields.description: Token passed back to a webhook in HTTP X-Webhook-Token header.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Client-generated name for all its hooks (e.g. backorder_management).

fields.name: hook_type
fields.description: Method of notification. Currently only webhook is supported.

fields.name: events
fields.description: Types of events the hook is subscribed to.

fields.name: config
fields.description: Configuration object depends on hook type. Currently only webhook_config is supported.

fields.name: auth
fields.description: Authorization object depends on hook type. Its content is encrypted in storage. Currently only webhook_auth is supported.

purchase_cancellation.description: A request to cancel a single purchase.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record
The non-detailed version of the purchase to which this cancellation request is linked.
fields.name: purchase

fields.description: Explanation of why the purchase could or could not be cancelled.
fields.name: detail
processed_at
fields.description: When the cancellation was actually processed.

operations.description: Search all vendors. Results are always paginated and do not include detailed vendors.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Finds the vendor with this name. Exact match

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Finds the vendor with this key. Exact match

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Finds all vendors with this tag. Exact match

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Retrieve detailed vendor with this key. Supports guids for backwards compatibility, but the use of guid is deprecated.
Delete the vendor with this key. Supports deletion by guid for backwards compatibility, but this is deprecated.
Search all vendor tags. Results are always paginated.
Gets one vendor tag.
Search all items. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: agreement_guid
parameters.description: Fetches items for the fulfilling vendor according to the specific agreement guid.

operations.description: Gets the detailed view of this item, including the full json document of all of the attributes.
Gets the detailed view of an item by vendor and number

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Attributes are part of the unique item composition. In they physical world, attributes would be sku-defining properties like color or size.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Metadata are additional properties of an item that are useful generally (like a product category) in describing the item.

operations.description: Allows an incremental update to an existing item.
Search all terms. Results are always paginated.
Search all agreements. Results are always paginated.
Update an agreement by specifying new values for some or all updateable fields.
Update an agreement by specifying new values for some or all updateable fields.
Search all shipment requests. Results are always paginated.

Returns the upcoming planned shipments for a given agreement, filtered by a certain number of days. For example, you can request all planned shipments in the next 30 days - you will then see the actual upcoming dates, if any, that an open shipment request will be cloesd. Results are always paginated.
Search all purchases. Results are always paginated.
Returns the purchase with this guid.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: Price of the item being purchased. Currency is that of the agreement.

operations.description: Search all purchase confirmations. Results are always paginated.
Search all receipts. Results are always paginated.
Search all purchase orders. Results are always paginated.
Closes an open purchase order ahead of schedule.
Update the purchase order's tags.
Retrieve the items in a purchase order. Results are always paginated.
Search purchase order authorizations.
Get a puchase order authorization by its guid.
Authorize a purchase order.

409.description: If the purchase order has already been authorized with a different number.

operations.description: Retrieve the hook.
Search hooks.
Create a hook.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Client-generated name for all its hooks (e.g. backorder_management).

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Currently only values of webhook_config type are supported.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Request to notify about events since a specific time on best-effort basis.

409.description: Hook for this reciver, type, and event(s) already exists.

operations.description: Update the hook.

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: If events field is present its value replaces the current event subscriptions, and add_events and remove_events are ignored.

operations.description: Search all cancellations. Results are always paginated.
Returns the cancellation with this guid.

202.description: The cancellation will be processed asynchronously to determine if it can be completed.
